page.title: 12A VILLAGE TEACHER
page.content: She has lived in{Charndon}all her life.Her father was a farmer. It was very hard work on the farm.There were no tractors,much of the work was done by hand and horses were used to pull the carts.One of her jobs was to take the farm workers their lunch and tea. Suet puddings and potatoes for lunch,bread,jam and cake for tea,with large jugs of tea,all balanced on her bike. She was a teacher for nearly 40 years,many of them spent in{Marsh {Gibbon School.}For a while she had to work at another school when numbers dropped.They had coke stoves,called tortoise stoves,in each classrom and childrens clothes were hung round them to dry. They went to church every morning. She{retired}in{1981}when numbers dropped at the school and a teacher was again asked to leave.
